properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Mexico Beach out 20 NM; Waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Mexico Beach from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued February 6 at 9:07AM CST until February 6 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Tallahassee FL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Mexico Beach out
20 NM...
Waters from Okaloosa-Walton County Line to Mexico Beach from 20 to
60 NM...

* Until 1100 AM CST.

* At 907 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 15 nm south of Oriskany Reef, or 34 nm
south of Pensacola Pass, moving northeast at 60 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts in excess of 50 knots.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels...and create suddenly higher waves. Make sure all
on board are in a secure location and wearing life
jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 50 knots and
suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain significant
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Return to safe harbor if possible.

* Locations impacted include...
Panama City Beach, Laguna Beach, Santa Rosa Beach, Sandestin and
Miramar Beach.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CST for the Panhandle of
Florida...and the adjacent coastal waters.
